Contributor.Organization: Vaccine Research Institute of San Diego

Column.Name: PRIMARY_LT2_GENE
Column.Description: first first STM LT2 gene represented (>97%ID over 100bp & >90% over entire fragment)

Column.Name: SECONDARY_LT2_GENES
Column.Description: further LT2 genes represented (>97%ID over 100bp & >90% over entire fragment)

Column.Name: SINGLE_CRITERIUM_LT2_GENES
Column.Description: more LT2 genes represented (>97%ID over 100bp & >90% over entire fragment)

Column.Name: LT2_GENE_NAME
Column.Description: best represented gene name in STM LT2

Column.Name: PRIMARY_CT18_GENE
Column.Description: first STY CT18 gene represented (>97%ID over 100bp & >90% over entire fragment)

Column.Name: SECONDARY_CT18_GENES
Column.Description: further CT18 genes represented (>97%ID over 100bp & >90% over entire fragment)

Column.Name: SINGLE_CRITERIUM_CT18_GENES
Column.Description: more CT18 genes represented (>97%ID over 100bp OR >90% over entire fragment)

Column.Name: CT18_GENE_NAME
Column.Description: best represented gene name in STY CT18

Column.Name: SPT SIMILARITY
Column.Description: sequence similarity in SPT PT4 over 100bp window

Sample.Title: 2h post-infection of THP-1 treated with 3 rounds of SCOTS, replicate 1

Channel.Organism: Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Typhi
Channel.Characteristics: Salmonella typhi infection of THP-1 cells, recovered 2 h post-infection
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: 2E7 THP-1 cells (treated with 1E-7 M phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate) were infected with Salmonella typhi at a multiplicity of infection of 10:1. At time 0, cells were washed with PBS and fresh RPMI containing 100 ug ml-1 was added to the wells. After 2 hours, cells were washed with PBS and recovered in 5 ml PBS. After centrifuation, the pellet was lysed with 2 ml TRIzol (Invitrogen).
Channel.Extract-Protocol: TRIzol reagent (Gibco BRL) was used according to the manufacturer instruction. RNA was treated with DNase (Ambion). RNA sample was converted to cDNA in 5 independent reverse-transcription reactions as described previously (Graham, J. 1999. PNAS 96:11554-559). Bacterial transcript were purified from host transcript by using 3 round of the SCOTS procedure (Daigle, F. 2002. Methods Enzymol. 358:108-122).
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: 1.5 µg of cDNA was labeled with Cy5-dCTP (GE Healthcare) by random priming with Klenow (New England Biolabs) as previously described (Porwollik, S. 2001. Mutat Res 483:1-11.).

Channel.Organism: Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Typhi
Channel.Characteristics: Genomic DNA from Salmonella typhi ISP1820
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Salmonella typhi from overnight culture in LB broth.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Genomic DNA was extracted by standard phenol-chloroform method (Sambrook, J, Molecular Cloning, 3rd Edition)
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: 1.5 µg of genomic DNA was labeled with Cy3-dCTP (GE Healthcare) by random priming with Klenow (New England Biolabs) as previously described (Porwollik, S. 2001. Mutat Res 483:1-11.).

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Samples we hybridized as previously described (Porwolik, S. 2003.Nucleic Acids Res 31:1869-76)
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slide was scanned with Scan Array Lite (Perkin-Elmer) using Scan Array Express 2.1 software.
Sample.Description: This sample was used to analyse the effect of SCOTS on transcript population and to analyse the expression profiles of Salmonella typhi during infection of human macrophages (THP-1)
Sample.Data-Processing: After backgroud correction and total intensity normalization, ratio to reference were calculated and log base 2 transformed.

Column.Name: CH1_SIGNAL_NOISE_RATIO_FILTER
Column.Description: Channel 1 signal to noise ratio filter

Column.Name: CH2_SIGNAL_NOISE_RATIO_FILTER
Column.Description: Channel 2 signal to noise ratio filter

Column.Name: PRE-VALUE
Column.Description: ch1 % of total / ch2 % of total

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: log base 2 of ch1 % of total / ch2 % of total

Channel.Characteristics: Genomic DNA from Salmonella typhi ISP1820
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Salmonella typhi from overnight culture in LB broth.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Genomic DNA was extracted by standard phenol-chloroform method (Sambrook, J, Molecular Cloning, 3rd Edition)
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: 1.5 µg of genomic DNA was labeled with Cy3-dCTP (GE Healthcare) by random priming with Klenow (New England Biolabs) as previously described (Porwollik, S. 2001. Mutat Res 483:1-11.).

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Samples we hybridized as previously described (Porwolik, S. 2003.Nucleic Acids Res 31:1869-76)
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slide was scanned with Scan Array Lite (Perkin-Elmer) using Scan Array Express 2.1 software.
Sample.Description: This sample was used to analyse the expression profiles of Salmonella typhi during infection of human macrophages (THP-1)
Sample.Data-Processing: After backgroud correction and total intensity normalization, ratio to reference were calculated and log base 2 transformed.

Series.Title: Expression profiles of Salmonella typhi inside human macrophages (THP-1) compared to supernatant
Series.Summary: Global expression profiles of Salmonella typhi grown in the supernatant of infection and within human macrophages at 0h, 2h, 8h and 24h were obtained. Stringent analytical methods were used to compare Salmonella typhi cDNAs and revealed that known virulence factors, such as the SPI-1 and SPI-2 encoded type III secretion systems, were found to be expressed as predicted during infection by Salmonella. Intracellular Typhi expressed many genes encoding antimicrobial peptides, used the glyoxylate bypass for fatty acid utilization, and, did not induce the SOS response or the oxidative stress response. Genes coding for the flagellar apparatus, chemotaxis and the iron transport system were down-regulated in vivo. The combined use of SCOTS and microarray is an effective way to determine global bacterial gene expression profiling in the context of host infection, without the need of increasing the multiplicity of infection beyond what is seen in nature. Keywords: Time course
Series.Overall-Design: cDNA was prepared by 3 round of SCOTS from the Supernatant of infection of THP-1 human macrophages and at 0h, 2h, 8h and 24h post-infection. 6 replicates were recorded for each conditions (Supernatant, 0h, 2h, 8h and 24h). Genomic DNA was used as a reference channel on each slide.
